organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: These data were downloaded from the National Atlas website (http://www.nationalatlas.gov/atlasftp.html) in August 2014

collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States of America, 1997-2014

abstract.gco:CharacterString: This raster layer portrays general forest cover types for the United States in GeoTIFF format. Data were derived from Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer (AVHRR) composite images recorded during the 1991 growing season, with the exception of Puerto Rico, for which Landsat Thematic Mapper (TM) data were used. A total of 25 classes of forest cover types were interpreted from the AVHRR and TM imagery, aided by field observations and refined with ancillary data from digital elevation models. The data available through the National Atlas of the United States are in GeoTIFF format. This is a revised version of the May 2002 map layer, with a corrected shoreline for Greenland. This layer is part of the 1997-2014 edition of the National Atlas of the United States.

purpose.gco:CharacterString: The forest cover types map layer was developed to portray broad distribution patterns of forest cover in the United States. The data should be displayed at scales appropriate for 1:7,500,000-scale data.

credit.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey and U.S. Forest Service. (2002). Forest Cover Types, United States, 2002. National Atlas of the United States. Available at: http://purl.stanford.edu/ng927vq0549.

useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: None. Acknowledgment of the National Atlas of the United States, the USDA Forest Service, and (or) the U.S. Geological Survey would be appreciated in products derived from these data.

Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the U.S. Geological Survey or the USDA Forest Service regarding the utility of the data on any other system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. Use of trademarks or formats does not constitute endorsement by the U.S. Geological Survey or the USDA Forest Service. There are no copyright restrictions on the use, redistribution, or further processing of this map layer. No responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Geological Survey or the USDA Forest Service in the use of these data.

title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States of America, 1997-2014

environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1.4959

measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: No tests for logical consistency have been performed on this map layer.
This map layer includes forest cover types for all 50 of the United States and Puerto Rico. Forest cover data were not available for the U.S. Virgin Islands.

description.gco:CharacterString: A detailed description of how the forest cover classes were derived from the AVHRR and TM source data may be found in USForest. This image was concatenated from the four images used to create the printed map in USForest: one image each for the 48 conterminous United States, Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico, respectively. Pixel values in the final image and their associated class names and red-green-blue color values are: >Value Class name RGB values >---------------------------------------------------------------- >0 ocean fill 132 193 255 >1 non-U.S. land 204 204 204 >2 White-red-jack pine 102 204 204 >3 Spruce-fir 255 255 51 >4 Longleaf-slash pine 255 153 102 >5 Loblolly-shortleaf pine 255 204 153 >6 Oak-pine 102 153 102 >7 Oak-hickory 153 255 153 >8 Oak-gum-cypress 102 153 153 >9 Elm-ash-cottonwood 153 102 51 >10 Maple-beech-birch 153 204 153 >11 Aspen-birch 153 102 153 >12 Douglas-fir 204 255 204 >13 Hemlock-Sitka spruce 102 204 102 >14 Ponderosa pine 153 204 102 >15 Western white pine 102 153 204 >16 Lodgepole pine 204 153 102 >17 Larch 204 102 51 >18 Fir-spruce 255 204 51 >19 Redwood 51 153 51 >20 Chaparral 153 153 102 >21 Pinyon-juniper 153 255 102 >22 Western hardwoods 204 153 153 >23 U.S. non-forest 255 255 255 >24 Lakes 132 193 255 >25 Alaska Spruce-birch 204 102 102 >26 Hawaii native forest 102 204 102 >27 Hawaii mixed forest 204 204 102 >28 Puerto Rico evergreen broadleaf forest 0 153 102 >
Coastlines in Canada, Mexico, Russia, and in the Caribbean were corrected. A GeoTIFF Revision 1.0 header was added and PackBits compression was applied to the image.

The coastline of Greenland was replaced by a new, corrected version derived from World Vector Shoreline (WVS). This image contains no thematic data for Greenland; the new data were inserted only to maintain consistency with other National Atlas data layers.

title.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Forest Types and Predicted Percent Forest Cover from AVHRR Data

organisationName.gco:CharacterString: American Society for Photogrammetry & Remote Sensing
